pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 304, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 5 Mechanics 2 (M2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 337]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 325, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 495, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 285, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 462, 907, 493]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 720, 510]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 590, 526]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 527, 606, 543]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 557, 606, 573]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 573, 756, 589]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 590, 440, 605]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 606, 907, 636]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[253, 82, 781, 215]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 235, 920, 286]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.4 \mathrm{kg}\) is attached to a fixed point \(A\) by a light inextensible string. The string is inclined at \(60^{\circ}\) to the vertical. \(P\) moves with constant speed in a horizontal circle of radius \(0.2 \mathrm{m}\). The centre of the circle is vertically below \(A\) (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 297, 153, 316]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 297, 487, 316]]<|/det|>
Show that the tension in the string is 8 N.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 298, 920, 316]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 327, 153, 346]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 327, 435, 346]]<|/det|>
Calculate the speed of the particle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 329, 920, 346]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 373, 92, 392]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 373, 920, 408]]<|/det|>
A stone is thrown with speed \(15 \mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) horizontally from the top of a vertical cliff \(20 \mathrm{m}\) above the sea. Calculate

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 413, 153, 432]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 413, 794, 432]]<|/det|>
the distance from the foot of the cliff to the point where the stone enters the sea,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 414, 920, 432]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 440, 153, 458]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 440, 514, 458]]<|/det|>
the speed of the stone when it enters the sea.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 440, 920, 458]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 485, 92, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 494, 821, 768]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 784, 920, 850]]<|/det|>
A smooth hemispherical shell, with centre \(O\), weight \(12\mathrm{N}\) and radius \(0.4\mathrm{m}\), rests on a horizontal plane. A particle of weight \(W\mathrm{N}\) lies at rest on the inner surface of the hemisphere vertically below \(O\). A force of magnitude \(F\mathrm{N}\) acting vertically upwards is applied to the highest point of the hemisphere, which is in equilibrium with its axis of symmetry inclined at \(20^{\circ}\) to the horizontal (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 861, 151, 880]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 861, 808, 880]]<|/det|>
Show, by taking moments about \(O\), that \(F = 16.48\) correct to 4 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 863, 920, 880]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 892, 153, 910]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 892, 920, 927]]<|/det|>
Find the normal contact force exerted by the plane on the hemisphere in terms of \(W\). Hence find the least possible value of \(W\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 910, 920, 927]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
The ends of a light elastic string of natural length \(0.8 \mathrm{~m}\) and modulus of elasticity \(\lambda \mathrm{~N}\) are attached to fixed points \(A\) and \(B\) which are \(1.2 \mathrm{~m}\) apart at the same horizontal level. A particle of mass \(0.3 \mathrm{~kg}\) is attached to the centre of the string, and released from rest at the mid-point of \(AB\). The particle descends \(0.32 \mathrm{~m}\) vertically before coming to instantaneous rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 151, 156, 170]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 151, 260, 170]]<|/det|>
Calculate \(\lambda\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 152, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 183, 153, 201]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 183, 660, 201]]<|/det|>
Calculate the speed of the particle when it is \(0.25 \mathrm{~m}\) below \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 183, 920, 201]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 229, 94, 247]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 227, 920, 293]]<|/det|>
One end of a light elastic string of natural length \(0.3 \mathrm{~m}\) and modulus of elasticity \(6 \mathrm{~N}\) is attached to a fixed point \(O\) on a smooth horizontal plane. The other end of the string is attached to a particle \(P\) of mass \(0.2 \mathrm{~kg}\), which moves on the plane in a circular path with centre \(O\). The angular speed of \(P\) is \(\omega \mathrm{rad} \mathrm{s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 306, 154, 324]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 306, 603, 324]]<|/det|>
For the case \(\omega = 5\), calculate the extension of the string.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 306, 920, 324]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 337, 153, 355]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 337, 915, 355]]<|/det|>
Express the extension of the string in terms of \(\omega\), and hence find the set of possible value of \(\omega\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 352, 920, 369]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 399, 96, 416]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[285, 411, 751, 465]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 482, 920, 533]]<|/det|>
\(O\) and \(A\) are fixed points on a horizontal surface, with \(O A = 0.5 \mathrm{~m}\). A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.2 \mathrm{~kg}\) is projected horizontally with speed \(3 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\) from \(A\) in the direction \(O A\) and moves in a straight line (see diagram). At time \(t\) s after projection, the velocity of \(P\) is \(\nu \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{-1}\) and its displacement from \(O\) is \(x \mathrm{~m}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 532, 920, 574]]<|/det|>
The coefficient of friction between the surface and \(P\) is 0.5, and a force of magnitude \(\frac{0.4}{x^2} \mathrm{~N}\) acts on \(P\) in the direction \(PO\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 592, 156, 610]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 588, 641, 612]]<|/det|>
Show that, while the particle is in motion, \(\nu \frac{\mathrm{d}\nu}{\mathrm{d}x} = -\left(5 + \frac{2}{x^2}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 592, 920, 610]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 628, 153, 645]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 628, 920, 661]]<|/det|>
Calculate the distance travelled by \(P\) before it comes to rest, and show that \(P\) does not subsequently move.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 644, 920, 662]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[329, 785, 670, 804]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Question 7 is printed on the next page.]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 81, 761, 288]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 305, 920, 356]]<|/det|>
\(ABCDE\) is the cross-section through the centre of mass of a uniform prism resting in equilibrium with \(DE\) on a horizontal surface. The cross-section has the shape of a square \(OBCD\) with sides of length \(a \mathrm{~m}\), from which a quadrant \(OAE\) of a circle of radius \(1 \mathrm{~m}\) has been removed (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 368, 153, 386]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 368, 920, 402]]<|/det|>
Find the distance of the centre of mass of the prism from \(O\), giving the answer in terms of \(a\), \(\pi\) and \(\sqrt{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 387, 920, 405]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 415, 153, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 415, 293, 433]]<|/det|>
Hence show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 434, 581, 454]]<|/det|>
\[3a^{2}(2 - a)< \frac{3}{2}\pi -2,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 458, 742, 479]]<|/det|>
and verify that this inequality is satisfied by \(a = 1.68\) but not by \(a = 1.67\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 459, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
